Wangechi has operated a hawking business, selling shoes to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing shoes. She dreams of establishing a shoe selling stall in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is  married and has five (5) children. Emilyn is 34 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Emilyn has a bamboo furniture business. She has had this business for 5 years. Her husband is the one who makes the furniture. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. Emilyn has been a member of PMPC for five (5) years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase bamboo and varnishing paints.

In the future, Emilyn hopes to market her bamboo furniture to adjacent municipalities & nearby cities.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and varnish for painting the bamboo furniture.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has one child who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mary Grace has a shop that sells sea foods like milk fish and flying fish. Aside from that, she is also selling canned goods, shampoo, soap and snacks. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy fish to sell like milk fish, flying fish and goods.

Mary Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Mary Grace hopes to improve her business in order to fund the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fish to sell, like milk fish and flying fish.

loans.name: May Anneliez

texts.en:
May Anneliez is 45 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. May Anneliez is married and has 4 children. 

May Anneliez has a general store that sells variety of products. May Anneliez has had this business for 25 years. May Anneliez has requested a loan of PHP 12000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

May Anneliez has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, May Anneliez hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Askarsho

texts.ru: Аскаршо проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Аскаршо уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей. Он открыл продуктовый магазин, где работает продавцом. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Askarsho lives in the Khamadoni district. He is 46 years old, married, and has five children. Askarsho has been innvolved in sales for more than eight years. He opened a grocery store, and works there as a vendor. He is requesting a loan to buy grocery products to expand his assortment of goods.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She operates a tailoring business and sells her goods to the general public. She dreams of opening a village poly-technique in the future. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Lucy’s greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. She describes seasonality to be her major challenge.

With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she plans to buy fabrics to make garments.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make garments.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Lorna is provides motorela, or motorcycle services, as her husband is the driver. Aside from this business, she has also a shop selling canned goods, shampoo, soap and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools like a T-wrench, an air compressor, a screw driver & to pay for the gasoline for the services.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her services to help to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of the motocycle, like a T-wrench, an air compressor and to pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a fish seller from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with 3 children, ages 2, 7 and 9. 

Candelaria has been selling fish for 15 years. She earns 6500 PHP each month with her business. Candelaria works hard to sustain her family and to pay for her children's education. She has applied for a loan to buy ice boxes, salt and more fish to sell. This will help increase Candelaria's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy ice boxes, salt and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 49 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis. She is married and has four children. 

Arlene has a shop that sells varieties of rice. She has had this business for three(3) years. She has requested a loan of 14,900.
Arlene has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Arlene hopes that all her children will finish their studies someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice for her retail business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
Reth lives in a rural area of Battambang province. She is 57 years old and a mother of four. She does rice farming and raises pigs to support her family’s living. She has been doing these types of work for nearly ten years. Her business usually faces problems when the pigs are sick and when the selling prices drop when the time comes to sell the pigs. 

Reth has been with VisionFund since 2011. She has applied for her third loan, after repaying all the obligations of the previous two loans with VisionFund. She now leads a loan group of two female members. Reth has requested the loan to cultivate her rice field, to hire another’s cows to plough the land, to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make more income to help her family to live in a better condition.

loans.use: to cultivate a rice field, hire a cow to plough the land, to buy rice seeds, fertilzers and pesticides.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Patricia has a shop that sells a variety of fruits. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy different kinds of fruits like apples, oranges and bananas.

Patricia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Patricia hopes to improve her business for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fruits to sell like apples, oranges and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. She is involved in fishing and works with her husband. Iluminada sells her husband's catch at the market. She works hard to help provide for their household needs. 

Iluminada is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, nylon and floaters. This loan will help increase their business profitability and hopefully will provide her family a more stable standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon and floaters.

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia is a married woman who has six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past one year, she has operated a beauty salon business, her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She also operates a restaurant business which she earns her other source of income. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Revelyn

texts.en:
Revelyn is 38 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Revelyn is married and has 3 children. 

Revelyn has an entertainment business and earns approximately PHP 16,000 each month doing this type of work. Revelyn has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional materials for a sound system. 

Revelyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Revelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for a sound system.

loans.name: Massaèr

texts.fr: Massaèr est un homme marié sans enfant. Il exerce le métier de chauffeur de taxi depuis trois ans. Il prend en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille avec les revenus tirés de son activité.Il épargne également une partie de ses bénéfices dans son compte ouvert au guichet de l'UIMCEC. Depuis deux mois, le moteur de son taxi est tombé en panne. C'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter un nouveau moteur afin de reprendre son activité.Son ambition est d'acquérir plus tard un second taxi.
texts.en: Massaèr is married, with no children.  He has been working as a taxi driver for the past three years.  Thanks to the income generated by his activity, he is able to take care of the family expenses.  He also saves part of his profits into his account at UIMCEC.  Two months ago, the engine of his taxi broke down.  This is why he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for the purchase of a new engine, in order to be able to work again.  His future ambition is to buy a second taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Rukwa Group

texts.en:
Asha is in her mid-40s and is a widow with three children in school. She has been running a food cafe for ten years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to increase the food cafe stock to sell to more people.  Her dream is to one day become an international businesswoman. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Rukwa," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase the food cafe stock.

loans.name: Casan

texts.en:
Casan is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Casan provides motorcycle services and has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools such as T-wrench and air compressor, and pay for gasoline for the services offered.

He has been a member of HSPFI since 2012, and he hopes to improve his services in the future in order to provide for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy tools such as T-wrench and screw-driver to maintain his motorcycle and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is married with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Lucita sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fishing nets for her fishing activity.

Lucita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years, and she hopes to purchase another fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing activity

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is a 30-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He earns a living by maintaining and servicing mango trees so that they can bear fruit. He provides services like spraying of fertilizers and caring for mango trees. Renante has had this business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. He plans to invest in buying and selling scrap materials to help supplement his income.

Renante has requested a loan to buy scrap and more spray materials. Renante hopes to succeed in his business venture.

loans.use: to buy scrap and more spray materials

loans.name: Ceciliah

texts.en:
Ceciliah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and has four children. Ceciliah owns rental houses. She first constructed a house worth $400 and then built other larger houses with her savings and the rent obtained from the first house. She learned of Milango from an employee, and joined the organization to get credit for business operations.
Ceciliah is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to install a door and windows in her new house that is currently under construction.
The only challenge in the current business is when some customers do not pay their rent on time, but Ceciliah looks forward to overcoming this by diversifying to other forms of businesses in the future, e.g. selling charcoal to increase her income.
Ceciliah’s ambition is to construct two more houses.

loans.use: To install a door and windows in her new house under construction.

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
This is Frisca, 24, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Remmel, who is in the navy, and has one child. She and her child manage their household while operating the business. Frisca works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Frisca operates a van rental business. She has one van, and services are provided within the city and the nearby provinces. Frisca also sells processed meats for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Frisca earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Frisca is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan, which she will use to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her van. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Frisca hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their van.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.  For the past 2 years, Jovelyn has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, buying and selling canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages. Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married and has three children, two of whom attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation. 

For the past three years, Leah has been operating a tailoring business, which has enabled her to provide better education to her children. She sells maize cereals as a side job for additional income. Leah's dream is to someday establish a tailoring school. Leah plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea, 63 years old, is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She fishes for a living. She helps her husband prepare fishing nets and sells his catch at the market. Timotea relies on fishing to meet her family's basic needs.

Timotea has requested a loan to purchase fish nets, hooks and other materials. She hopes for their business to grow and for her family's living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Soulèye

texts.fr: Soulèye est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants.Il est membre d'une famille de tradition d'éleveurs.Face aux difficultés rencontrées dans la pratique de l'élevage traditionnelle, il décide de se lancer dans l'embouche bovine, plus facile et plus rentable.Il ouvre un compte à l'UIMCEC et épargne une partie de ses revenus.Les prets obtenus de l'institution lui permettent ainsi de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter ses revenus. Aujourd'hui, il est parvenu à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Afin de mener une nouvelle opération d'embouche , il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter deux bœufs. Il ambitionne de construire un enclos pour mieux sécuriser ses bêtes.
texts.en: Soulèye is married and the father of four children.  He belongs to a family of cattle breeders.  Faced with the challenges of traditional cattle breeding, Soulèye has decided to turn to cattle fattening, which is an easier and more profitable activity.  He has opened an account with UIMCEC and saves part of his income.  The loans from the institution allow him to strengthen his activity and to increase his earnings.  As a result, he has been able to improve his family's living conditions.  In order to start fattening cattle again, he is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs for the purchase of two oxen.  His ambition is to build an enclosure, to keep his cattle safe.

loans.use: to buy two oxen.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana, de oficio comerciante, madre de tres hijos, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí. Es dueña de un pequeño puesto de comida,  negocio el cual inicio hace 22 años lo puso en su hogar pero hoy en día alquila un local en la parte comercial de la ciudad donde la afluencia de clientes es muy constante. Ella vende almuerzo y desayunos hace entrega delivery y al mismo tiempo recibe cliente en su pequeño local. Este negocio le ha ayudado a sostener a su familia y poder vestirlos, darles educación, tener para los gastos médicos, es por ello que mantener la calidad de su negocio es muy importante porque de ello depende su manera de sobrevivir y salir adelante. Ella usara el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, carne, pollo. Pues son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para hacer sus platillos y ofrecer en el menú de cada día. Ella nos cuenta que tiene en sus planes poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Ana, a businesswoman and mother of three kids, is a resident of the city of Estelí. She is owner of a small food stand, a business she started 22 years ago in her home. Nowadays she rents a location in the commercial part of the city where the affluence of clients is very steady. She sells lunch and breakfast and makes deliveries while receiving clients in her locale at the same time. This business has helped her to sustain a family and be able to dress them, give them an education, have money for medical expenses, and it is because of this that maintaining the quality of the business is very important for her. She depends on it to survive and to get ahead. She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, and chicken, as these are part of the ingredients she uses to make her plates and offer the menu for the day. She tells us that she has plans to put a local store in her home as well.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef, and chicken

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en: Abenawa has been selling smoked fish for 15  years. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes them to sell. Abenawa is married and has 3 children. She uses her income to help her husband with the children's general upkeep. Abenawa will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell. Abenawa will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children, both enrolled in school. For the past year, she has operated two businesses: a cosmetics shop and a garage. Her other source of income is earnings from her spouse.

Esther plans to use this KES 70,000 loan to purchase beauty products for the cosmetics shop and spare parts for the garage. She hopes to build a rental house in the future. Esther lives in a rented house that has electricity but no piped water. Esther joined Yehu since they care for their clients.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products for the cosmetics shop and spare parts for the garage.

loans.name: Jamiykul

texts.ru: Жамыйкул 57 лет, вдова, воспитала сына.   В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Жамыйкул начала свой бизнес в торговле одеждой, стартовав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Жамыйкул сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Жамыйкул  обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Жамыйкул планирует частично вложить в покупку скота, так как имеет сарай для содержания , и часть – в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Jamiykul is 57 years old and a widow, she has raised her son.  In 2000, in search of a source income for her family, Jamiykul started her own business selling clothing, starting with a sum of 10,000 somoni (KGS).  Thanks to her perseverance and hard work Jamiykul was able to grow her business to a monthly income of 6,000 somoni (KGS).  Today her product assortment does not appear abundant and because of this Jamiykul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 somoni (KGS) in order to expand her product assortment.  Jamiykul plans to invest a portion of the income from the loan into the purchase of livestock as she has a shed for raising them and a portion into expanding her business.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: María Jacqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos de  22, 16, 13, 11 y 5 años  de edad, los dos menores  estudian en escuela todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una muy buena esposa y madre que además le gusta ganar algo de dinero para ayudar a mantener el hogar, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados y si no ella se vale por si sola para atender a sus clientes. Tiene más de 8 años con su negocio y con los créditos lo ha ido mejorando con el paso de los días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Jaime Roldos" meets every 15 days in the city of Jaramijo. Known for its beautiful beaches, here the majority of residents are very hardworking and dedicated to sea-related work. 

Here we met Maria, 41 years old, who is married and has 5 children from this relationship - 22, 16, 13, 11 and 5 years of age. The two youngest study in school and all of her children still live with her. Her husband works as a fisherman.

She is a very good wife and mother and she likes to earn some money to help maintain the home. She has a grocery store in her house, from which she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and detergents among other things. She works every day from 6am to 8pm and sometimes until much later. Her children help her when they aren't busy which helps her be able to attend to her clients. She has had this business for more than 8 years, and with various loans has been improving it as the days go by. 

This loan will enable her to invest more in her business, to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessity products. She has been with this Communal Bank for 7 cycles and she enjoys it because the loans have been a great help to her. 

Her goals are go get ahead with her business and that her store continues to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other basic necessity products

loans.name: Loeurn's Group

texts.en:
Loeurn, age 58, is the mother of eight children, five of whom are still dependent on the family. For the past 10 years, Loeurn has been farming rice and planting corn to earn a living. Loeurn has been with VisionFund since 2011 and has taken out five loans, all completely repaid. She has now applied for another loan to cultivate rice during the hot season. She hopes the loan will help her to generate more income so that she can send her children to school until they graduate, so that they could later have proper work to support themselves.

Loeurn is the leader of a loan group of two female members, both living in a rural area in the Bovel district.

loans.use: To cultivate the rice paddy during the hot season

loans.name: Esther Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos  a la señora Esther, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 15, 10 y 6 años de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella y dos de sus hijos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que para ayudar a su esposo con la dura tarea de  mantener un hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, así como también sabanas y edredones, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta ya que recorre por toda la ciudad con su mercadería, nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas son bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres días a la semana, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Ella empezó con su negocio desde que ingreso al banco comunal y nos cuenta que a pesar de la competencia le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, sabanas, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
The Jaime Roldos Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo canton, a place known for its beautiful beaches and where most of the people are very hardworking and involved in fishing.

Here we meet Esther, 35, married, and with four children: 17, 15, 10 and 6.  Three of her children still live with her and are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She is very hard-working and helps her husband with the hard chores in keeping up their house.  She sells all types of clothing, as well as sheets and bedspreads.  She goes door to door throughout the city with her merchandise but she tells us that most of her sales come from orders placed by her customers.  She works three days a week, sells on credit and collects weekly.  Esther travels to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise whenever necessary.  She started her business when she began with the communal bank and says that despite the competition, it’s going well.

She will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, sheets, etc.  She has been in the bank since its inception and she likes it because of the help the loans give her.

Her dream is to continue getting ahead with her life and her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, sheets, etc

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una joven cusqueña que tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de suplementos alimenticios Herbalife en la ciudad del Cusco, que es en donde ella vive. Ella necesita un préstamo para poder continuar su actividad comercial y adquirir más productos Herbalife y venderlos a su cada vez más numerosa clientela.
Luz Marina desea continuar vendiendo estos productos para que en un futuro pueda construir su casa y retribuir el apoyo que recibe por parte de su familia.
Luz Marina pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a young resident of Cusco, 22 years of age and single, who works selling Herbalife nutrition supplements in the city of Cusco. She needs a loan to be able to continue this activity, so she can buy more Herbalife products and sell them to her ever increasing clientele. 

Luz Marina wishes to continue selling these products so that in the future she can build a house and repay the support that she has received from her family. 

Luz Marina belongs to the Communal Bank "San Rafael" in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products

loans.name: Antonia Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una mujer muy luchadora y optimista, es madre, de dos hijas las cuales son mayores de eda, las cuales estudian y Leonor lucha cada dia para poder ofrecer a sus hijas una buena educaicon y sean mejores que ella, por ello se levanta muy temprano todos los dias para atender su negocio de venta de comida, lo que le permite generar los ingresos que necesita para sus hijas.

Ella ha pasado por alggunos problemas pero ello le ha enseñado a seguir adelante y sacar fuerzas de donde no las tiene para seguir y dar el ejemplo a sus hijas de que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio se puede lograr lo que nos proponemos.

Leonor esta muy contenta y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podra  comprar algunas mesas y sillas que son necesarios para su negocio, ya sus clientes se han incrementado y debe poder brindarles un mejor servicio y un lugar cómodo, asi seguira trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener un gran restaurant".
texts.en:
Leonar is a very hardworking and optimistic woman. She has a mother of two older daughters who both study, and Leonor fights every day to be able to offer her daughters a good education so they can be better than her. As a result she wakes up very early every day to tend to her business selling food, which allows her to earn the income that she needs for her children. 

She has had a few problems but these have taught her to keep pushing ahead and to find strength where she didn't know she could in order to continue and serve as a good example for her daughters, and with much effort and sacrifice she is able to achieve what she sets out to. 

Leonor is very happy and grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their great support she will be able to buy some tables and chairs which are necessary for her business as her client base has increased and she would like to offer them better service and a comfortable place. As a result she will keep working to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: "to have a great restaurant."

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Juntos Podemos” en el distrito del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por diez personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, venta de artesanía, venta de boletos turísticos, venta de útiles de escritorio, venta de verduras, venta de accesorios personales y otros brindan servicios. 
 
(La señora Jesusa está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Jesusa vive en la hermosa ciudad del cusco y donde realiza sus actividades cotidianas, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Jesusa es la compra y venta de verduras en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Jesusa requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como por ejemplo tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, papas y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank "Juntos Podemos" ("Together We Can") in the district of Cusco. This Communal Bank is composed of 10 people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead, and with their daily effort be able to offer a better future to their children. The economic activities of the group members include: sale of groceries, sale of cosmetics, sale of handicrafts, sale of tourist tickets, sale of office supplies, sale of vegetables, sale of personal accessories and others provide other services. 

Jesusa is the woman in the picture who has her hand raised. Jesusa lives in the beautiful city of Cusco where she completes her daily activities. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Jesusa's main economic activity is the purchase and sale of vegetables in one of the popular markets in the city of Cusco. At this time, Jesusa requirers a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, carrots, potatoes and other things. 
 
The group members in general appreciate the opportunity provided and promise to comply with their loan repayments according to the established time-frames. 

The city of Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, right in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas, and it is characterized as a tourist zone for its archeological sites, historic center, landscapes, history, traditional festival to the Inca Sun God, and because it is near the site of one of the seven wonders of the world "Machu Picchu."

loans.use: to buy vegetales such as tomatoes, onions, carrots, potatoes and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil, peanut butter, and honey to resell

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is an extremely hard-working individual who has always dreamed of having his own business. To make this goal attainable, he has been working a full-time day job at a hotel, while operating his business during the night time hours when he is off. 

Five months ago, Kareem began devoting more time to his business and just last month was able to get his business to be officially registered. The business works as a catering and event planning business that is primarily devoted to large performances that pass through Atlantic City. Kareem has seen success thus far but wants to keep growing his business. 

In May, a large performance is coming through Atlantic City and Kareem has already begun planning an event around the show. He would like this loan to help him prepare for this event by pre-booking a venue and marketing the event on a large scale.

loans.use: to prepare for a large client event in May

loans.name: Guy

texts.en:
Guy has owned and operated his own technology store for over two and a half years. He originally started this business after the housing crisis a few years ago. At the time he was working in real estate and for AT&T. With the time that was freed up from his job in real estate, he decided to venture into business ownership and fulfill his entrepreneurial spirit. When he founded his technology store, he wanted it to be more than just retail, he also wanted it to provide practical services for his customers. 

Some of the services that he set up are small business consulting for new companies on what technology might be best for them on an individual basis, and more personal, hands on, training for customers who might want to learn more about various products that they are purchasing. Guy would like this loan to help his business grow by offering a larger range of products. With a larger range of products, Guy will also be given more clients for his educational services.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to diversify the products his store offers

loans.name: Sisia Yémalin

texts.fr: Sisia Yémalin est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Sisia Yémalin est mariée à un certain Jules. Sisia Yémalin a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Sisia Yémalin et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sisia Yémalin exerce le métier de coiffure depuis quatorze ans environs. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sisia Yémalin vend des mèches, des bijoux et des produits de cheveux. Sisia Yémalin s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Sisia Yémalin désire rehausser le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Sisia Yémalin sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sisia Yémalin is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Jules. She halted her studies in secondary school and then learned how to style hair. The couple have four children, who are all in school. Three of the children are in their care. Sisia Yémalin and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To cope with her different expenses, Sisia Yémalin  sells hair extensions, jewelry, and chair products. She gets her supplies in Benin and in Togo. This business enables her to meet the needs of her children and to support herself. 

Sisia Yémalin wishes to boost her business, and this will allow her to respond effectively to the requirements of her customers. For this reason, she  is requesting a loan for the fifth time from ALIDé. The previous loan were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, jewelry, hair products, and a steam dryer

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Ester moved to the United States from Brazil to join some of her family who were already living in the Greater Boston Area. Making this move, she left her two sons in Brazil and decided to support them by working in the United States. To support her boys, Ester and her sister decided to become partners and open a beauty salon together. Both of them had a wealth of experience working in this industry, and Ester even owned her own shop while living in Brazil.

 After seeing success with their business, Ester and her sister decided to split as partners and both explore their own businesses. Her sister opened another beauty salon and Ester was left as sole owner of the one they had previously opened. She would now like to expand this business. Her business currently has 5 full-time employees and 2 part-time employees. This loan would be used to purchase more products to diversify her shop and bring in more business.

loans.use: to purchase new products to diversify the services her beauty salon offers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony is a 40-year-old man, who is married to Burlina, a 36-year-old lady. They have been blessed with four children, namely: Erdy, 11, attending 5th grade of elementary school; Melan, 8 attending 1st grade of primary school; Stanley, 5; and Kristian, 3.

Tony owns a business selling "betel" and sliced "areca" nuts. Every week Tony buys his business stock in large quantities from farmers. From the business Tony is able to support his family.

Prior to running his current business, Tony had a toy shop but it did not do well. Limitation in capital led him to stop the business for a while. Now he plans to restart the business. Therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 7,500,000 from TLM. He would like to purchase toys for his small shop and more "betel" to sell.

loans.use: to purchase toys for his small shop and more "betel" to sell.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and all members of Kucup Mekar agreed to continue to have loans for their businesses. They still need a loan to develop a business raising pigs. They will stop borrowing when they have enough savings for their own capital.

With full support from her husband who works as a farmer, Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy 2 superior type piglets for  500,000 IDR each. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy feed. By still keeping the pigs for fattening, Ni Ketut hopes there will be an increase in profits. For everyday needs, Ni Ketut gets money from her husband and her business sales cover the means of worship of Hindus.

loans.use: To buy 2 superior type piglets

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Demba est un chauffeur de taxi interurbain qui transporte ses clients de sa localité à une grande ville située à 10 kilomètres.Il fait plusieurs voyages par jour.Il a en charge sa femme, ses trois enfants ainsi que deux de ses frères.Face à la concurrence, il envisage de renouveler de rendre son taxi plus beau et plus performant. Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f pour acheter des portières, des pneus, des coussins et de la peinture.Son ambition est d'acheter un nouvel taxi.
texts.en:
Demba is an inter-urban taxi driver who transports customers in his town to a large city located 10 km away. He make several trips per day. He supports his wife and three children, as well as two of his brothers. 

In face of the competition, Demba envisions renovating his taxi to make it nicer and perform better. He is therefore requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy some car doors, tires, cushions, and some paint. His ambition is to buy a new taxi.

loans.use: to buy car doors, tires, cushions, and some paint.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of porridge flour for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 

Erlinda has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo & beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Aishake

texts.ru:
Айшаке 64 года, вдова. Айшаке долгое время проработала преподавателем в школе с. Мин-булак и была награждениа званием «Заслуженный учитель». В 1996 году, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Айшаке начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Начав этот бизнес в суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  1 корова, 2 теленка, 1 нетель, а также 10 га поливной земли, где она выращивает фасоль, многолетние травы и картофель. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айшаке обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян фасоли и  закуп горюче-смазочных материалов.  Доходы от кредита Айшаке планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Aishake is 64 years old, and is a widow. She worked for many years as a teacher at the Min-Bulak village school, and was awarded the title "Teacher Emeritus". In 1996, Aishake got involved in agriculture and animal husbandry as a means of acquiring more income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, her business, which began with 5,000 somi (KGS), now has one cow, two calves, one heifer, as well as ten hectares of irrigated land where she grows beans, perennial herbs, and potatoes.

To expand her business, Aishake has asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 somi (KGS) to buy bean seeds, fuel and lubricants. Aishake plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like snack foods, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like snack food, detergent and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies and other equipment for her internet cafe business.

Dyna has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Dyna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies and other equipment.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 44 years old and widowed with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Josefa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, diapers, and other groceries. 

In the future, Josefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 52 years old and married with 10 children.

Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

Erenia has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Erenia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells boxed soap and powdered soap at Breman near Elmina.  She is married to a farmer and has 5 children. Ekua has been selling soap for 5 years.  She uses her income to supports her husband in the upkeep of the family. Ekua will use her loan to purchase boxes of soap and powdered soap  to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to aquire different kinds of detergent to sell.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and powdered soap to sell

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
I Ketut, 66, lives with his wife, son and daughter. His wife is a housewife who helps manage the pig-raising business. Currently, I Ketut has four sows and seven pigs fattening. Although the business is still small in scale, it has been enough to help provide for his family.

Waste generated from the business of pigs has not been able to be fully used because it is polluting. After being informed about the management of sewage waste into biogas, I Ketut has been enthusiastic about many of the positive impacts that can be obtained from the biogas as environmentally friendly energy and organic fertilizer. 

He hope to build a biogas reactor to get maximum results from his business and also take part in environmental conservation efforts as well as serve as a model for surrounding communities.

loans.use: To build a biogas reactor.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos o mais velho já frequenta Escola. Fez o nível superior e no futuro pensa em aumentar o seu nivel. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
Trabalha como docente há mais de 14 anos no Distrito de Boane, é do quadro do Ministerio da Educação e tem como salário 10.250.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM).

Já teve empréstimos no (BIM) e pagou ate ao fim sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega de serviço que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 23.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, chapas, pedra, cimento, ferro e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.000.00mt, 7.000.00mt e 8.000.00mt aplicados na mesma actividade.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e construir outra para aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gilberto was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 2 children, the oldest of whom goes to school.  He studied through college, and in the future, he wants to pursue more education.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.  He has worked as a teacher for more than 14 years in the district of Boane.  He belongs to the Board of Education.  His salary is 10,250 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.  He has had loans through BIM and paid them back without any problems.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague who is also a client of the institution.  This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 23,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy construction materials for his home (beams, sheet metal, stone, cement, iron, etc.).  His previous loans were for 7,000, 7,000, and 8,000 meticals, and they were also put towards his home.

He promises to pay back his loan on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his home and construct another one to rent out, for which he is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (beams, sheet metal, stone, cement, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Abajyamugambi No .3 Group

texts.fr:
Benoit fait partie du groupe Abajyamugambi No 3. Il a 49 ans, il est marie avec 7 enfants de 3 ans à 20 ans, dont 5 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Benoit est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est sollicitée d’autres crédits pour finance son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Benoit voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benoit is part of the group Abajyamugambi No 3. He is 49 years old and married, and he has seven children, from 3 to 20 years old. Five of the children have had schooling. He has a 6th grade education.

Benoit is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is the second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy some chemical fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor.

His strategy for the growth of his business is to request more loans to finance his farming. 

In the next few years, Benoit would like to be a better rice producer in his region. With the profits, he plans on paying for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Sr. De Huanca Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” en la centro de poblado de Yanahuara del distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba. Este banco comunal está conformado por doce personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de chicha, compra y venta de animales menores, venta de jora, venta de verduras, venta de artesanía, venta de cosméticos y otros brindan servicios. 
 
(La señora Placida está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Placida nació en el centro poblado de Yanahuara y vive donde  nació, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre y padre para sus tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de Placida es la venta comida y bebidas alcohólicas, ella tiene una pequeño local o picantería donde expende comida típica de la región como por ejemplo chicharon, pescado frito, lechón, cuy al horno y otras comidas, también vende chicha de jora y cerveza. En esta oportunidad Placida requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo jora (Ingrediente básico para hacer chicha), verduras, carne y otras cosas más.
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Señor de Huanca” in the center of the village Yanahuara, part of the district of Urubamba and province of Urubamba. This communal bank is made up of twelve people that look for opportunities to get ahead every moment and provide their children with a better future with their daily effort. For example, the members' economic activities include: selling chicha- an alcoholic drink made from fermented maize-, buying and selling young animals, selling traditional corn liquor, selling vegetables, selling handicrafts, selling cosmetics, and others provide services.

(Placida is raising her hand in the photograph.) The member Placida was born in the center of the village of Yanahuara and lives where she was born. She is forty years old and a mother and father to her three children. Placida's main economic activity is selling food and alcoholic drinks. She has a small business or restaurant where she sells food that is typical of the region, like pork cracklings, fried fish, suckling, roast guinea pig, and other foods. She also sells traditional corn liquor and beer. In this instance Placida needs this loan to buy supplies like maize (the basic ingredient to make traditional corn liquor), vegetables, meat, and other things.

Over all the members are thankful for the opportunity given to them and commit to fulfilling the payments of their different fees according to the established installments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like maize, vegetables, meat, and other things.

loans.name: Médégnonmi Rufine

texts.fr: Médégnonmi Rufine est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Médégnonmi Rufine est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Nestor. Médégnonmi Rufine a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Médégnonmi Rufine et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Médégnonmi Rufine exerce le métier de coiffure depuis treize ans environs. Parallèlement à cette activité, Médégnonmi Rufine vend des mèches dans son atelier. Médégnonmi Rufine s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Médégnonmi Rufine désire rehausser le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Médégnonmi Rufine sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Médégnonmi Rufine is 39 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a welder by the name of Nestor. She halted her studies in secondary school and then learned how to style hair. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Médégnonmi Rufine and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To cope with her different expenses, Médégnonmi Rufine has been working as a hairdresser for about thirteen years. Concurrent to this business, she sells hair extensions in her salon. She gets her supplies from Benin and from Togo. This business enables her to meet the needs of her children and to support herself. 

Médégnonmi Rufine would like to boost her business, and this will enable her to respond effectively to the requirements of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the third time. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est âgée de 26 ans et vit au Bénin. Bernadette est mariée à un certain Léonard. Bernadette a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Aucun des enfants n'est scolarisé. Bernadette et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Bernadette exerce le métier de coiffure depuis huit ans environs. Parallèlement à cette activité, Bernadette vend des mèches et des bijoux dans son atelier. Bernadette s'approvisionne au Togo et au Nigeria. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Bernadette désire rehausser le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Bernadette sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Bernadette is 26 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a man named Léonard. Bernadette dropped out of primary school and then learned how to style hair. The couple support three children, of whom two are their own. None of the children have had schooling. Bernadette and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

Coping with her various expenses, Bernadette has been working as a hairdresser for about eight years. Concurrent to this business, she sells hair extensions and jewelry in her salon. She gets her supplies from Togo and from Nigeria. This business will enable her to meet the needs of her children and to support them. 

Bernadette would like to boost her business, and this will enable her to respond effectively to the requirements of her customers. For this reason, Bernadette is requesting a loan for the third time from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, hair products, and jewelry

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de  5 filhos todos vão a Escola. Fez apenas 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo quando se juntou ao seu marido, é comerciante há mais de 10 anos e vende roupa diversa onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária e no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve empréstimos noutros bancos e pagou ate ao fim sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (tubos, barrotes, chapas, ferro e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 11.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.  
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e construir outra para aluguer, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the district of Chibuto, in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  She is married and is the mother of 5 children, all of whom go to school.  She studied through the sixth grade and didn't continue due to her parents' lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

She left Gaza for Maputo when she met her husband.  She has had a business for more than 10 years selling various clothing.  She makes close to 6,000 meticals per month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account and through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

She has had loans with other banks and paid them back without problems.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials for her home (pipes, beams, sheet metal, iron, etc.).  Her previous loans were for 11,000 and 20,000 meticals, and they were also put towards her home.

She promises to make her payments on time, and in the future, she wants to finish her home and construct another one to rent out, for which she is planning on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home (pipes, beams, sheet metal, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Francisca Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Jaime Roldos se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 63 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y aún viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida desde hace mas de 12 años emprendió un pequeño negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda general en su casa, allí además de víveres también vende cosas de bazar y ahora también ciertos útiles escolares para aprovechar la época de entrada a clases, helados entre otras cosas, allí trabaja todos los días, nos cuenta que empezó con poco y que con el paso del tiempo ha ido mejorando mucho su negocio y esto gracias a los créditos que ha recibido del banco.

Este crédito es para surtir de víveres su tienda y comprar útiles escolares que es lo que más se vende. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brinda la Fundación Espoir con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud ya que esto es lo más importante.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jaime Roldos meets every 15 days in the canton of Jaramijo. This place is known for its beautiful beaches and here most of the residents are very hardworking and make a living doing work involving the sea.

In this place we met Francisca. She is 63 years old and many years ago her husband passed away, but from that relationship she had five children who are older and still live with her.

To make a living our friend undertook a small business more than 12 years ago. She has a small general store in her home. Besides provisions she also sells hardware, certain school supplies in order to take advantage of the start of the classes, and ice cream, among other things. She works there every day and tells us that she began with little, and with the passing of time has improved her business greatly thanks to the loans she's received from the bank.

This loan is to supply her store with provisions and buy school supplies which are sold the most. She's a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the help with which Fundación Espoir provides her with the loans.

Her dream is to get ahead and enjoy good health since this is what's most important.

loans.use: to buy provisions and school supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, Sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho já maior de idade. Fez apenas 5ª classe e não continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
É comerciante há mais de 10 anos, vende produtos de primeira necessidade no mercado local e na sua casa. Nesta actividade consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária e no Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Já teve empréstimos noutros bancos e pagou sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sabão, farinha, óleo, feijão e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 20.000,00mt e 20.000,00mt ambos para a mesma actividade.
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende aumentar a capacidade do seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is the single mother of one son, who is already an adult.  She studied through the fifth grade and didn't continue due to financial difficulties.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else.

She has had a business selling basic goods for more than ten years.  She sells at the local market and in her home.  With this work, she makes a monthly income of almost 7,000 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account and through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system).

She has had loans with other banks and paid them back without any problems.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 20,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy products (rice, soap, flour, butter, beans, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  Her previous loans were for 20,000 meticals each, and they both went towards her business.

She promises to pay back her loan on time.  In the future, she wants to expand the capacity of her business, for which she wants to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy and sells products (rice, soap, flour, butter, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Abadahemuka /shr Group

texts.fr:
Philippe fait partie du groupe Abadahemuka. Il a 34 ans, il est marie avec 6 enfants de 8 mois à 12 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Philippe est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des fertilisants sélectionné pour augmenter la production. Dans les prochaines années, Philippe voudrait être un meilleur producteur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais scolaire et médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Philippe is a member of the Abadahemuka Group.  He is 34 years old, and is married with six children ranging from eight months to twelve years old, four of whom are in school.  Philippe has six years of primary education.

Philippe is a rice farmer.  This is his second loan through ACB.  He plans to use his loan to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labour costs.  

His strategy for the future growth of his business is to use selective fertilizers to increase his productivity.  In the coming years, Philippe would like to become the premier rice producer in his region.  With his profits, he plans to pay tuition and medical fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos um deles a frequentar a Escola. Fez apenas 3ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras pelos pais. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
Trabalha numa empresa de construção civil como operador da máquina de betão há mais de 10 anos, onde recebe 12.725,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Já teve empréstimos noutros bancos e pagou sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (areia, cimento, chapas, ferro e outros).
 Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende concluir e mobilar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mario was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 2 children, one of whom goes to school.  He studied through the third grade and didn't continue due to his parents' lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He has worked for a construction company as a cement truck operator for more than 10 years.  He makes 12,725 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account.

He has had loans with other banks, which he paid back without problems.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials for his home (sand, cement, sheet metal, iron, etc.).

He promises to pay back his loan on time.  In the future, he wants to finish and furnish his home, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (sand, cement, sheet metal, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Carlos

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mocuba, Província da Zambnezia, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos já maior de idade. Fez 12ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de tempo. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
Veio a Maputo em missão de serviço, É reformado do Banco de Moçambique e técnico de farmácia há mais de 20 anos. Tem um salário de 11.000,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do salário da sua esposa poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BIM)

Já teve empréstimos noutros bancos (SOCREMO e PROCREDIT) e pagou sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (barrotes, areia, cimento, pedra e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende terminar a sua obra, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the district of Mocuba in the province of Zambnezia in central Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 3 adult children.  He studied through the 12th grade and didn't continue due to lack of time.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He came to Maputo on an assignment with the military.  He is retired from the Bank of Mozambique and has been a pharmacy technician for more than 20 years.  He makes 11,000 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  With the help of his wife, he also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has had loans with other banks (Socremo and ProCredit), which he paid back without problems.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is his first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 meticals.  He will use it to buy construction materials for his home (beams, sand, cement, stone, etc.).

He promises to pay back his loan on time.  In the future, he wants to finish his home, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his home (beams, sand, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Abiodoun Akim

texts.fr: Abiodoun Akim est âgé de 22 ans et vit au Bénin. Abiodoun Akim a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Abiodoun Akim vit et assure seul les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a deux ans, afin de subvenir à ses besoins, Abiodoun Akim vend des produits congelés dans sa boutique au Bénin. Abiodoun Akim s’approvisionne dans des poissonneries au Bénin. Abiodoun Akim désire acquérir un nouveau congélateur qui lui permettra de garder à froid ses poissons, afin de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Abiodoun Akim sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Abiodoun Akim is 22 years old and living in Bénin.  Abiodoun Akim left school at the secondary level.  He lives and takes care of the different household needs on his own.  

Two years ago, in order to make ends meet, Abiodoun Akim started selling frozen products from his shop in Bénin.  He buys his stock from fisheries in Bénin. He would like to purchase a new freezer, which will allow him to keep his fish frozen.  This will enable him to better meet the demands of his clientele.   To accomplish this, Abiodoun Akim is asking for his second loan via ALIDé.  His first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for storing fish.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 40 years old. He lives in Kareli District, East Georgia with his family: his wife, Ludmila, and two sons (17 and 19 years old). The family earns a living through agricultural business. They have a small pig farm with 2 pigs and 10 piglets. The family sells on average 15 piglets per year.  In addition, Alexander is busy with the family dairy farm. They have two milk cows. Ludmila produces cheese and sells on average 30 kg of this product in the village. Along with the above-mentioned, the family owns 2.5 hectares of agricultural land. They grow tomatoes, onions and potatoes on the plot. Alexander sells harvested products locally to greengrocery products retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Alexander requested a loan to rent a tractor for tilling the land. In addition, he will purchase fertilizers and drugs for fertilizing the land and treating the plants for parasites. After properly doing seasonal agricultural work, the family will work hard on the plot during the spring period. Alexander hopes that the weather conditions are favorable as well and the family gets a good harvest in the summer. The family will sell the harvest through already-known distribution channels. Alexander plans to use the received profit for financing his children’s education.

loans.use: to rent a tractor, purchase fertilizers and drugs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with an 8-year-old child. She sells plastic bags, water and vinegar containers, straw and brooms. Mary Jane is able to buy her family's basic needs with her income. She does her best to improve her business and sustain her child's education.

Mary Jane is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as plastic bags, brooms and containers. This will help increase Mary Jane's sales and profitability. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as plastic bags, brooms and containers

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells cloth and saucepans at Breman near Elmina. Adjoa is married with five children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation bills and feed their children. Adjoa will use her loan to purchase cloth, saucepan and bowls for sale. With the new profit, Adjoa will acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, saucepans and bowls to sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos 1 já maior de idade e o outro frequenta a Escola. Fez 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém. 
		
Trabalha como servente na barragem dos pequenos libombos há mais de 16 anos e tem um salário de 11.000,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária (BARCLAYS).

Já teve empréstimos noutros bancos (BARCLAYS) e pagou sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (ferro, barrotes, areia, cimento, pedra e outros). Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000,00mt e 12.000,00mt ambos aplicados na mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo e no futuro pretende concluir e mobilar a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais empréstimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ines was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique.  She is the single mother of 2 children, one of whom is an adult, and the other is in school.  She studied through sixth grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and doesn't support anyone else besides them.

She has worked at the Barragem dos Pequenos Libombos [a hydroelectric dam] for more than 16 years.  She makes 11,000 meticals per month, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account at the Barclay's bank.

She has had loans with another bank (Barclay's) and paid them back without any problems.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy construction materials for her home (iron, beams, sand, cement, stone, etc.).  Her previous loans were for 10,000 and 12,000 meticals, and both went towards her home.

She promises to pay back her loan on time.  In the future, she wants to finish and furnish her home, for which she plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.
