She is a very enterprising, humble woman who is very honest and with many goals to reach, one of which is to expand her business and stay ahead of her competition.  She knows that success comes from putting in great effort and dedication; and she knows these are her best tools to get ahead in her work.  With this motivation, she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy more wholesale clothing.  Aracely del Carmen has the confidence to continue working alongside her husband to cover household expenses and give the best they can to their children.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Heha Group

texts.fr:
Thedeus fait partie du groupe Heha, et il habite à Bujumbura. Il  est âgé de 33 ans et est marié à Francine, commerçante de boutique.  Ensemble ils ont 4enfant, dont 3  étudient à l’école primaire.

Il  fait  le transport de viande, de l’abattoir au marché central de Bujumbura , depuis 12ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va payer les frais de réparation de sa voiture  en panne,pour avoir une deuxième voiture de transport. Les rentrées vont augmenter.

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter d’autres véhicules de transport pour  s’équiper d’avantage, des  terrains cultivables, et sa propre parcelle.
texts.en: Thedeus is a member of the Heha group. He lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Francine, a shopkeeper.  Together, they have four children, three of whom are in primary school.  For the past 12 years, Thedeus has transported meat from the slaughterhouse to the central market in Bujumbura.  He is on his second loan with Turame. With this loan, he is going to pay for the repair of his broken down car, to have a second transport vehicle.  Revenues will increase.  In the coming years, he would like to buy more vehicles to equip himself with an edge, land suitable for growing crops, and his own farm.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of his broken down car, to have a second vehicle.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Abdou est un homme marié. Il est père de trois enfants.Il gère depuis quatre ans une boutique de produits alimentaires.Il prend en charge sa femme, ses enfants et ses deux parents avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Il est implanté dans un quartier très populaire ; ce qui lui vaut une grande clientèle. Pour satisfaire cette forte demande, il sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant notamment du riz, de l'huile, du sucre et d'autres denrées diverses. Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en: Abdou is a married man and father of three children. For four years, he has managed a food store.  He supports his wife, his children, and his two parents with the income from his business.  He is located in a very popular neighborhood which earns him many customers.  To meet this strong demand, he is asking for a loan of 400,000 francs to strengthen his business by buying rice, oil, sugar and various other goods.  His goal is to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar and various other goods.

loans.name: Kaba

texts.fr: Kaba est un reporter - photographe professionnelle.Il exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années.Cette activité qui est très rentable dans sa localité, lui permet d'obtenir des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et d'épargner une partie de ses bénéfices. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Afin de se doter d'un matériel plus performante, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter un appareil photo numérique.Son ambition est d'ouvrir un laboratoire de tirage de photos.
texts.en: Kaba is a professional reporter-photographer.  He has been in this profession for a few years.  This career is very profitable in his community and allows him to earn income that enables him to take care of the needs of his family and to save a part of his profits.  He is married and father of two children.  In order to acquire more powerful equipment, he is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a digital camera. His ambition is to open a photo finishing lab.

loans.use: to buy a digital camera.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie, a single mother of two children, both in school, lives in Kampala, Uganda where she sells Irish potato chips at the market on a retail basis. In business for the past year, Jackie works seven days a week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.

Jackie has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy one sack of Irish potatoes and cooking oil. Her goals are to purchase a machine for frying chips and build her own house. She lives in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma, 39 years old, lives in Khoni District, West Georgia with her family: her husband, Gocha; 20-year-old son; 18-year-old daughter; mother-in-law and sister-in-law. Gocha works as a driver for a local company, while her daughter and sister-in-law have health problems and receive relevant pensions from the local government.

Irma works hard the entire day. She and her mother-in law head the family's agricultural business, consisting of a milk cow from which Irma produces cheese, selling on average 20 kg per month at the local open market. The family also has a greenhouse, where greens and tomatoes are grown. Harvested products are sold at the market as well. Average total monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pensions of Irma’s mother-in-law, sister-in-law and daughter.

Irma is requesting a loan to start a small poultry business. She will purchase chickens to raise in an old hen house owned by the family. After three months she will begin selling eggs. Also part of the loan will be used for cultivation of the family-owned plot of the land where Irma will sow maize to feed the chickens. The resulting increased income will allow the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ousseynou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousseynou est un jeune de 31 ans  qui fait de l’aviculture depuis 1 an et demi. Il est aussi employé comme gardien dans une entreprise de la place.
Ousseynou vient solliciter pour la deuxième fois un crédit de 125000F CFA pour compléter l’aliment de ses poussins dont la vente est prévu pour le 10 mai.  Il va acheter  11sacs d’aliment à 14500F le sac.
Il est marié et prend en charges les besoins alimentaires de sa famille. Il a comme  projet  d’agrandir son activité et d’avoir un grand poulailler.
texts.en: Mr. Ousseynou is 31 years old and has been a poultry farmer for the past year and a half.  He is also employed as a guard at a nearby business. Ousseynou is asking for his second loan of 125,000 CFA to supplement the poultry feed for his chicks whose sale is scheduled for May 10.  He will buy 11 bags of feed at 14,500 francs per bag.  He is married and supports the nutritional needs of his family.  He is planning to grow his business and to have a large poultry house.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed for his chicks.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 43 years old, married, and has five children.  To earn a living, she does poultry farming.  She has been in the business for six years.  She also raises goats for extra income.  She has grown her business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Susan hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Ndoffane

texts.fr:
Ndoffane est un jeune marié sans enfant.Il tient un magasin de vente de tissus. Il est implanté au coeur du marché central; ce qui lui vaut une bonne fréquentation des clients.Il génére ainsi des revenus assez consistants qu'il utilise principalement pour entretenir sa famille dont il est le seul soutien.
Pour augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un pret de 250000f afin d'acheter des tissus. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un autre magasin et d'y mettre son frère.
texts.en: Ndoffane is a young married man without children.  He owns a fabric store.  He is located in the heart of the central market, which gives him good  customer traffic.  He earns consistent enough revenues that he uses mainly to support his family for which he is the sole provider.  To increase his income, he is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy fabric. His ambition is to open another store where he would employ his brother.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 67 years old. She lives in Tskaltubo District with her family, a 45 year-old son and two grandsons (18 and 19 years old). Her elder grandson is a student and the younger one goes to school. Makvala is retired and she gets monthly income. She runs the dairy farm owned by the family. They have 3 milk cows. Makvala produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. Her son is a worker. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 Laris. 

Makvala requested credit for renovation of the house, as it is old and the living conditions of the family are very poor. After a couple of months, they will finish the renovation and have a better environment in the house to have proper rest after hard-working days.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 47 years old and married.  She has 2 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Jenelyn runs a direct-selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock.  Jenelyn has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as lotion, shampoo, soap, detergent, etc.. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she a can send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en: Mary Joy is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children who are in school.  Mary Joy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Mary Joy has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  In the future, Mary Joy would like to save money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Helen has a shop that sells snacks (native delicacies like rice cake, banana cake and hot cakes). She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000PHP to buy raw ingredients like sugar, rice, flour, banana chips and cheese.  Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like rice cake, banana cake and hot cakes

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en: Rahel is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 30,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes to add stock to her food selling business. Since the last loan, her profits have increased and she is now living a better life. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes to add stock to her food business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. She is 42 and the mother of five children with three still schooling.

She has been in mixed farming for 15 successive years and currently sells her produce of bananas, vegetables and avocado to the local markets.

Jane has requested a loan of 20,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a a dairy cow. She says farming has been her sole source of income through which she meets her family needs. She says the venture into dairy farming will provide milk for family consumption and additional income that will go into educating her children.

She laments,  however, about occasional drought and dairy animal diseases that are inherent in farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a petty trader. She sells footwear, which she has done for five years. She lives at Briman near Elmina.  

Abena is married and has four childern. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Abena  will use her loan to purchase footwear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her to sell the footwear.

loans.use: to purchase footwear to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah runs a sari-sari (variety) store in Talibon, Bohol. She sells items like sugar, vinegar, canned goods and toiletries. Sarah started her business a year ago. She earns 6,000 PHP each month. 

Sarah works hard to support her family, especially her three children's educations. 

She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and snacks. Sarah hopes for this loan to help improve her business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as detergent soap, canned goods and snacks.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita is married and has a lumber yard business in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now.

Nenita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional wood for her business.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 55, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines, and the mother of two children. Her husband is Mario, a maintenance staffer. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Erlinda operates an accessories retail business. She buys accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products can include beaded jewelry such as necklaces and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams to have a shop in the mall and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise that she sells in her business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua cooks banku for sale. Banku is a dish made with corn dough, and she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at  Breman near Elmina. She has done this for two years. 

Akua is married and has four children. She uses her income to support the husband in paying for their accommodation and food bills. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish that she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Milagro Antonia

texts.es: Milagro Antonia tiene un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia, elabora diferentes clases de prendas para dama, caballero y niño, en diferentes estilos, faldas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, elabora todo al gusto de la clientela, además los precios son accesibles y el servicio único, Milagro siempre se encuentra con una sonrisa en el rostro, es lo que dicen sus clientes; es una mujer muy enérgica y con muchas ganas de obtener un futuro próspero, a pesar de su edad, nunca dejar de aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida siempre se encuentra al frente de su labor ganándole a la competencia, piensa que el éxito no es la clave de la felicidad sino la felicidad es la clave del éxito, tiene esa felicidad interna, es por eso que con mucha seguridad le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor entre otros accesorios de confección a fin de promover mas la venta de prendas elaboradas y posiblemente salirlas a vender de forma ambulante. Milagro Antonia tiene confianza que podrá lograr alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Milagro Antonia has a sewing workshop in her home. She makes clothing for women, men, and children. She makes many different styles including skirts, dresses, pants, shirts, among others. She is well known in her area because her work is of good quality. She makes everything according to the tastes of her customers. In addition, the prices are reasonable, and her service is superb. Her customers say that Milagro always has a smile on her face. She is an energetic woman with a lot of drive to achieve a prosperous future. Despite her age, she never stops aspiring to a higher quality of life. She can almost always be found taking charge of her work and increasing her skills. 

She believes that success is not the key to happiness, but rather, happiness is the key to success. She has inner happiness, which is why she feels confident in requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which would allow here to purchase wholesale material, among other sewing accessories. With the loan she hopes to increase sales of the clothes that she makes, and possibly go out to sell as a mobile vendor. Milagro Antonia is confident that she will succeed in achieving a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase wholesale cloth

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has six children.
 
Federico has a pigpen and he sells mature pigs. He has had this business for five years. 

He requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy animal feeds for the pigs like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

Federico has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Federico hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs like hog grower, hog starter and hog finisher.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi fries doughnuts for sale in Breman, near Elmina.

She is married and her husband is a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their accommodation bills. 

Esi will use her loan to purchase sugar, flour, and cooking oil to fry the doughnuts for sale. With the new profit, Esi will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour and cooking oil to fry the doughnuts for sale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une femmes mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Après avoir arrêté ses études, il y a de cela cinq ans, elle a commencé une formation en couture. Elle ouvre ensuite un atelier de couture à domicile avec une machine.Aujourd'hui, elle en compte trois. Elle parvient ainsi, avec son activité à subvenir à ses propres besoins et à soutenir ses enfants et son mari. Afin de renforcer ses capacités de production et la qualité de ses services, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pur acheter une machine à coudre et des produits de mercerie .Son ambition est d'ouvrir une boutique de vente de produits de mercerie.
texts.en: Aminata is a married woman and mother of three children, two of whom attend school.  After finishing her studies five years ago, she began training as a tailor.  She then opened her own tailoring shop at home with one machine.  Today, she has three.  With her business, she is able to provide for her own needs as well as support her children and her husband.  In order to strengthen her production capacity and the quality of her services, she is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a new sewing machine and notions (i.e. items used in sewing).  Her ambition is to open a shop selling notions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and notions.

loans.name: Komeza Group

texts.fr:
Diane fait partie du groupe Komeza et  elle habite à  Bujumbura.Elle a 28  ans et est mariée à  J.Baptiste.  Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants, âgés de 9 à  12 ans, ils étudient  à l’école primaire. Elle supporte sa mère.

Elle   fait le commerce d’essuie-mains depuis 8 ans.

Elle est à son sixième  crédit  à  Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’essuie-mains à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation et que ses enfants poursuivent leurs études à l’étranger.
texts.en:
Diane is part of the Komeza group. She lives in Bujumbura. She is 28 years old and is married to Jean Baptiste. The couple have 2 children, aged 9 and 12. Both children go to primary school. Diane also supports her mother.

Diane has been selling hand towels for 8 years. She is on her 6th loan with Turame. The Kiva-sponsored loan that she will get will increase her capital and she will buy a large quantity of hand towels for resale, so that she can earn more. In the years ahead, Diane would like to become an importer and would like her children to go and study abroad.

loans.use: to buy hand towels.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 48 years old, married and has seven children.

Nieves works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her general store.

Nieves has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Nieves aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and seven dependents at Breman near Elmina. 

Efua produces fanti kenkey for sale. Fanti kenkey is made out of maize. She has been in this business for 30 years now. She use her income to assist the husband in paying their accommodation bills.  

Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fair wood to produce her kenkey for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fair wood to produce her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Bumwe Group

texts.fr:
Emilienne fait partie du groupe Bumwe et elle habite à Gitega.  C’est une veuve de 46 ans. Elle  a 8 enfants, âgés de 14 ans à 21 ans. Ces enfants étudient.

Elle est  couturière depuis  30 ans.  Elle confectionne aussi des habits à vendre.

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter des  tissus et accessoires utilisés dans son métier,pour gagner plus. Le crédit lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Emilienne is a member of the Bumwe group. She lives in Gitega. She is a 46-year-old widow with 8 children, aged between 14 and 21. Her children all go to school.

Emilienne has been a seamstress for 30 years. She also makes clothing for resale. She is on her 8th loan with Turame. With the Kiva-sponsored loan that she gets, her capital will be increased and she will buy some fabrics and job-related accessories, so that she can make more money. This loan will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and job-related accessories.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou, âgé de 30 ans, est un maçon de profession.  Il est marié et père de famille. Il vient pour la 1ère fois solliciter l’appui de l’IMCEC pour un crédit de 250000 FCFA  pour acheter du bois de coffrage. Vu qu’il obtient des chantiers  un peu partout, il était obligé de louer des planches pour pouvoir exécuter son contrat. Maintenant pour minimiser ses dépenses, il veut avoir son propre matériel.
Modou gère la dépense quotidienne de sa petite famille : la nourriture, les factures d’eau, de téléphone et d’électricité. Dans l’avenir il aimerait élargir son activité et créer sa propre entreprise de construction.
texts.en: Mr Modou is 30 years old and a mason.  He is married and a father.  He is asking for his first loan from IMCEC of 250,000 FCFA to buy wood formwork.  Because he has constructions projects a bit everywhere, he has been obliged to rent planks to fulfill his contracts.  Now, to minimize his expenses, he wants to have his own materials.  Modou manages the daily expenses of his small family: food, utility bills (for water, telephone, electricity).  In the future he would like to expand his business and set up his own construction company.

loans.use: to buy wood formwork (planks) for his construction projects.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase basic staples such as sugar, beans, salt, rice, etc, to stock her small store.

loans.name: Ramon Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Ramón Juan de Dios tiene 46 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con su madre e hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Pertenece a la ventanilla Los Girasoles.
Ramón Juan de Dios se dedica a la venta de maíz molido además se dedica a la agricultura siembra maní.
Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como abonos, urea y fertilizantes para los sembrios de manì.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá invertirlo en su negocio.
Las compras y ventas de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en Pichincha, Ventanas.
El sueño es seguir adelante para que su negocio prospere y tenga éxito para poder cubrir gastos necesarios.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es seguir luchando para incrementar su negocio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Ramon Juan de Dios is 46 years old, single and has one son.  He lives with his mother and son in the Canton Ventanas in the Province of los Rios.  He belongs to the communal bank "Sunflowers."

Ramon Juan de Dios works selling corn meal and he also grows peanuts.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, urea and fertilizers for his peanut fields.  With the help of the loan he will be able to invest in his business.

He undertakes the purchase and sale of the products he needs frequently in Pichincha, Ventanas.

His dream is to continue forward so that his business prospers and he has success to be able to cover his required expenses.  The challenge that confronts him is continuing to increase his business.  

In his free time he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, urea and fertilizers for his peanut fields.

loans.name: El Hadji Massal

texts.fr:
Monsieur El Hadji Massal est un jeune entrepreneur qui a créé un GIE  en y associant des membres de sa famille. Ce dernier a pour vocation : l’agriculture, l’aviculture, l’élevage, le commerce général, le transport, l’import-export et les prestations de services. Cependant en ce qui concerne ce crédit, il aimerait développer le volet aviculture. En effet il détient une grande ferme dans un village environnant ou il a investit 5000 sujets de poulets  pondeuses. Vu que c’est la période de début de ponte leur alimentation augmente, c’est pourquoi il demande un crédit de 260000FCFA pour acheter 20 sacs d’aliments à 13000Fcfa le sac. El Hadji Massal est âgé de 47 ans, il est marié et père de famille. Il a acquis une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine.
Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et son activité a impacter sur son voisinage vu qu’il a en vu d’aider pas mal de jeunes du quartier pour leur offrir un petit travail sur quoi ils pourront compter pour subvenir à leurs petits  besoins quotidiens
texts.en:
El Hadji Massal is a young entrepreneur who created a Economic Interest Group with other members of his family. His lines of business include: agriculture, poultry farming, breeding, general trade, transport, the import-export business and the provision of services. However, he would like to use this loan to develop the poultry farming element. He actually owns a large farm in a neighbouring village, where he has invested in 5000 laying hens.

El Hadji Massal is requesting a loan of 260 000 francs with which to buy 20 bags of feed (at 13 000 francs / bag) as this is the start of his hens' laying period and their feeding increases.

El Hadji Massal is 47 years old, married and a family man. He has 10 years' experience in this area. He takes care of his family's daily expenditure and his business should also have a positive impact on his neighbourhood as he plans to help a lot of the youth in his area by offering them small jobs, on which they will be able to count to help them meet their small daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed for his laying hens.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru:
Надире 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Надира работает учителем начальных классов и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 2006 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Надиры на сегодняшний  день имеется  18 овец, 3 коровы с телятами.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Надира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп 2 голов нетели.  Доходы от кредита Надира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Nadira is thirty-seven years old, the mother of three children. She works as an elementary school teacher, but, in order to supplement her income, in 2006 she began a business of raising animals. Nadira had a starting capital of 15,000 soms; today, she holds 18 sheep and three cows with calfs. 
Hoping to expand her business further, Nadira approached "Bai Tushum and Partners", requesting a loan of 60,000 soms in order to purchase two heifers. 
She plans to invest profits generated from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салим проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Салим более восьми лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он берет кредит для посева помидоров и огурцов.
texts.en: Salim lives in Tursun-zoda. He's thirty-two years old, married and has two children. For over eight years he's worked as a farmer. Salim's asking for a loan in order to plant tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to plant tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru:
Алтынай 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Алтынай с 2006 года занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS), которая были использована для покупки элитных сортов картофеля. В хозяйстве Алтынай на сегодняшний  день имеется 3,0 га земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп семян картофеля и горюче-смазочных материалов.  Доходы от кредита Алтынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Altynai is twenty-six years old, married and has three children. Her family's main source of income is Altynai's business. She began it in 2006 when, with a starting capital of 5,000 soms, she purchased and planted some high quality crops of potatoes. Today she owns 3 hectares of land filled with beans and potatoes. 
With a desire to expand her business further, Altynai approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 60,000 soms in order to purchase potato seeds and fuel. She plans to invest profits from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.fr:
Désiré fait partie du groupe Business et   habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 27ans. Il a en charge son ami.
Il fait le commerce des habits et des chaussures dames, depuis 9 ans.

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  d’autres chaussures à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter sa propre parcelle et fonder  un foyer.
texts.en:
Désiré is a member of the "Business" group. He lives in Bujumbura. He is single and 27 years old. He has one dependent friend.

Désiré has been selling clothing and ladies shoes for 9 years. This is his first loan from Turame. The Kiva-sponsored loan will increase his capital and he will buy more shoes for resale, so that he can earn more. In the years to come, he would like to buy his own plot of land and set up a home.

loans.use: to restock on shoes.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a fish monger. She buys fresh fish from the seashore to sell. Adjoa has been selling fresh fish for five years now. She is married with five children. She uses her income to help her husband feed and clothe their children. Adjoa will use this loan to purchase fresh fish to sell. Adjoa will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba lives with her husband and six children at Breman near Elmina. For a number of years, she has sold gari, a type of dried cassava that is usually fried. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children's school fees.  

Aba is requesting a loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. She will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: purchase gari to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married to a farmer and has two children. For the past three years, she has sold salt and shea butter at Abreshia near Elmina. Esi uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children's school fees.

Esi is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of salt and shea butter to sell. She will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase salt and shea butter to sell

loans.name: Nimrezzi

texts.en: Nimrezzi is a woman with 3 children, none of whom attends school. She sells firewood and charcoal from her home, mostly to her neighbors. Other sources of income include earnings from children and husband. Nimrezzi aspires to open a hotel in the future, and she describes theft to be her major challenge. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She plans to use the loan of 30,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and bundles of firewood.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina cooks banku for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Breman near Elmina. Paulina has done this for 10 years. 

Paulina is married and has 6 children. She uses her income to support the husband to feed and pay their accommodation bills. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a single parent and has five dependents. They live together in Abreshia near Elmina. Aba is a petty trader. She sells plastic bowls which she has done for four years. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay for their school fees. Aba will use her loan to purchase more plastic bowls to sell. She will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls to sell.

loans.name: Ndèye Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Ndèye Coumba est une commerçante depuis plus de 13 ans. Elle est âgée de 37 ans et est célibataire. Elle fait de la vente de produits cosmétiques (parfum, crème) ; de tissus (wax, meulfeu) ; de chaussures...Elle n’est pas novice dans le crédit car elle a fait parti d’un groupement. Actuellement, elle demande un crédit de 150000Fcfa pour honorer une commande de tissus, chaussures et parfum.
Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne puisqu’ elle vit chez ses parents.
Dans l’avenir, il aimerait avoir un fond plus consistant pour diversifier ses produits et services et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses parents et la sienne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Coumba has been a retailer for over 13 years. She is 37 years old and single. She sells beauty products (perfume, cream), fabric (wax and Meulfeu; the traditional dress of the Saharan women, a large and wide veil of material tied around the body in a Sari-like manner) and shoes. She is experienced in the area of credit as she has been part of a group (of borrowers) before.

Ndèye Coumba is currently requesting a loan of 150 000 francs so that she can fulfill an order for fabric, shoes and perfume. She lives with her parents and contributes to the daily expenses. In the future, she would like to have a more consistent funds so that she can diversify her products and services and improve her and her parents' living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabric, perfume and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 22 года. Он холост. Шухрат занимается торговлей. Кроме того он занимается перевозками. В этой области он пять лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Shuhrat lives in the city of Khujand. He's twenty-two years old and single. He makes a living by selling and transporting goods. He's done this for the last five years. Shuhrat is asking for a loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Namig

texts.ru: Namig 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Namig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Namig uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya posadkoy luka na svoyom pole. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN ctobi kupit udobreniye dlya uludsheniya kachestva posajennogo produkta, luka.
texts.en: Namig is forty-five years old. He's married and has two cihldren. Namig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP); he had to leave the city of Fuzuli and now resides in the Fuzuli region with his family. For the last five years, he's been planting onions on his field. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to purchase fertilizers and increase the quality of his onions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel tiene 41años. El es casado tiene dos hijos que aun son pequeños y van a la escuela. El trabaja como vendedor ambulante de productos como toallitas de mano, medias, franelas para vehículos, repasadores de cocina entre otras cosas.
El realiza sus ventas subiendo en los ómnibus, visitando comercios, en las avenidas principales  y en la mayor cantidad de zonas que le sean posibles. El anhela ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, terminar de construir su modesta vivienda y brindar siempre dentro de sus posibilidades una vida digna a su familia.
 Necesita de este crédito para comprar un lote de productos que le están ofertando, como ser gorros de lana, guantes, medias de lana y sus habituales productos ofrecidos.
texts.en:
Daniel is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children who are still small and attending school. He works as a street vendor selling products such as hand towels, stockings, wiping cloths for vehicles, and dishcloths, among other things.

Daniel makes his sales boarding buses, visiting markets, and in the principal avenues, in as many zones as possible. He hopes to see his children complete their studies, and to finish construction of his modest dwelling, and to offer always, within the realm of possibilities, a worthy life for his family.

Daniel needs this loan to buy a supply of products on offer, such as wool caps, gloves, woolen socks, plus the products he usually offers.

loans.use: buy wool caps, gloves, woolen socks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Makuti A Group

texts.en:
Pili is in her mid 30s and is married with two children. One of her children goes to school. Since 2009, she has been running a shop and she works from six in the morning through ten at night to be able to make a small monthly profit. Pili has borrowed six previous loans that she used to buy missing shop items, pay school fees, pay rent for her house and her shop, and to cover household and hospital expenses (her husband was hospitalized). She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Pili is requesting her seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her shop inventory. She will share this loan with her loan group, "Makuti A," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the future, Pili dreams of one day opening another retail shop.

loans.use: to increase her shop inventory

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 32 years old and is married with four children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past five years, Emelda has run a business raising and selling pigs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.

Emelda is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed such as hog starter, hog grower, and hog finisher. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells hair extensions, wigs and cosmetics at Abreshia near Elmina. She has been selling cosmetics for 6 years. Esther is married. She supports the husband in the general upkeep of the family. Esther will use her loan to purchase more hair extensions, wigs and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions, wigs and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Twizerane Group

texts.fr:
Anastie fait partie du groupe Twizerane. Elle a 54 ans, elle est marie avec 3 enfants de 18 ans à 25 ans, aucun enfant scolarise. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.
Anastie est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 30 kgs des maïs (semences) 2 sacs des engrais chimique, location d’un champ et payer la main d’œuvre.
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la capacité agricole et demander d’autres crédits. Dans les prochaines années, Anastie voudrait être une meilleure agricultrice de maïs dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de construire une maison et assure le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anastie is a member of the Twizerane group. She is 54 years old and married with three children (ranging from 18 to 25 years old). None of her children have received schooling. She has five years of primary school education.

Anastie is a rice grower. This is her third loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy 30kg of corn (seeds), 2 bags of chemical fertilizer, rent out a field, and pay the labor costs.

Her growth strategy for her business is to buy other fields in order to increase her agricultural capacity and seek other loans. In the coming years, Anastie would like to become one of the best corn growers in her region. With the profits, she plans to build a house and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 30kg of corn (seeds), 2 bags of chemical fertilizer, rent out a field, and pay the labor costs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús tiene 59 años de edad es soltera tiene diez hijos, vive con sus hijos en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Los Girasoles.
Teresa de Jesús se dedica a la venta de alimentos no cuenta con un local vende en área libre, ademas se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar los productos faltantes para la preparación de alimentos como cebollas, carne, pollo, arroz, tomates, plàtanos, condimentos para su preparaciòn, vasos, cubiertos y vajillas para dar un mejor servicio.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar mi negocio y al tiempo que yo necesito.
Las compras y ventas de los productos necesarios las realiza frecuentemente en el Cantón Ventanas.
El sueño es seguir adelante para que su negocio pròspere con gran éxito para poder cubrir los gastos como educación y problemas de la salud para sus hijos.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son problemas de salud y seguir luchando para incrementar su negocio.
En el tiempo libre le gusta realizar reuniones con grupos de personas mayores para realizar ejercicios
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 59 years old, is single and has ten children.  She lives with her children in the Cantón of Ventanas in the province of los Ríos. She belongs to the communal bank Los Girasoles ("The Sunflowers").

Teresa de Jesús works selling food.  Se does not have a food stall but sells in an open area.  She also raises animals such as hens.  She is requesting the loan to buy products that she needs to prepare food, such as onions, meat, chicken, rice, tomatoes, bananas, condiments for their preparation, glasses, silverware and china in order to offer better service.  With the help of the loan she will be able to enlarge her business when she needs to.

She buys and sells the items she needs frequently in Cantón Ventanas.

Her dream is move forward so that her business can proper with great success so that she can cover expenses such as the education and health problems of her children.

The challenges that she confronts are health problems and continuing to struggle to increase her business.

In her free time she likes to get together with elderly people to exercise.

loans.use: to buy the products needed to prepare food, such as onions, meat, chicken, rice, tomatos, bananas, condiments for their preparation, glasses, silverware and china in order to offer better service.

loans.name: Joslyne

texts.en:
Joslyne is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Josselyn has been working hard to manage her small business, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Josselyn has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids , and will help Joslyne to generate greater profits and expand her business. Joslyne hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for her self. 

Joslyne is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Joslyne's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married to a farmer and has six children. For the past three years, she has been cooking rice and fish stew to sell at Breman near Elmina.  Efua uses her income to support her husband and help feed, clothe, and pay their children’s school fees.

Efua is requesting a loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell. She plans to build a better business stall with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Alma has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  

In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is from Magsaysay, Balingao Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years of age, married, and has six children. Leonida used her last loan to buy goods to sell. Her retail business is successful and she's taking a new loan for her coconut production to purchase farm fertilizer. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, age 33, and resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Regie, a conductor, and mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Cecilia operates a food stall. She sells snacks like fruits, juices, and other street food staples that she sells in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she uses in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cecilia dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana produces palm oil for sale at Abreshia near Elmina, which she has done for 4 years now. Nana is married to a farmer and has 4 children. She uses her income to support the husband to feed and clothe their children. Nana will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to produce her palm oil for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Nana will buy a machine for the production of her palm oil.

loans.use: purchase palm fruit to produce her palm oil for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi  makes liquid soap for sale at Abreshia new Elmiina, which she has done for 6 years now. Esi is married and has 6 children. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their children’s school frees. Esi will use her loan to purchase raw material to make her liquid soap. With the new profit, she will make more liquid soap to sell.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make her liquid soap.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada pero no tiene hijos aun. Ella se dedica  a comercializar productos Herbalife, que son suplementos nutricionales autorizados. Mariela trabaja en el ámbito de la ciudad del Cusco, pero también vende sus productos en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convención de Cusco - Perú
En esta oportunidad Mariela necesita un préstamo para poder comprar mas mercadería y cubrir todo su mercado y tener contenta a su clientela.

Mariela está segura que trabajando duro en esta actividad, podrá rentar un local apropiado para expender sus productos y poder realizar sesiones de psicoterapia, oficio que ella ha estudiado y quiere desarrollar.

La señora Mariela pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36, married, but does not have children yet. She sells Herbalife products, which are authorized nutritional supplements. Mariela works in area of the city of Cusco, but she also sells her goods in Quillabamba city, Convención province of the Cusco region, Peru. 

Mariela hopes to take this opportunity to request a loan that she needs to be able to purchase more merchandise, have her market covered, and ensure her clients are content. Mariela is certain that by working hard in this line, she will be able to rent a suitable place to sell her products and be able to do psychotherapy, an occupation she has studied and would like to develop. Mariela belongs to the communal bank “San Rafael,” of the city of Cusco.

loans.use: purchase natural health products

loans.name: Sanchirmaa

texts.en:
Sanchirmaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She, with her family, lives in dormitory. Her husband is unemployed at the moment. Her elder child is a school student and the younger one is a kindergarten student. 

She started her hairdressing business in 2004 by taking professional courses and worked as a hairdresser. In 2009, she started to rent her own place for business. Over the years, she became well known by her skill in the neighborhood. She is a skilled young woman who says, "Since I am the only one with the income in the family. I need to expand my business by purchasing additional equipments. Also, I would like to save money and to buy my own house." She is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy additional equipment.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment.

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en:
Angielyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Angielyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, bread, soap, detergents & beverages.
Angielyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Angielyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: Zenabu lives together with her husband, who is a security professional, and  6 dependants at Abreshia  near Elmina. Zenabu sells air extensions, wigs  and  cosmetics. Zenabu has been selling cosmetics for 5 years. She supports her husband in the general up keep of their family. Zenabu will use her loan to purchase more  extensions, wigs and cosmetics for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more extensions, wigs  and  cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and married with 6 children. With 3 children in school, Agnes works very hard to provide for them.

Agnes runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Agnes has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 49 years old and married with 7 children. With 4 children in school, Perla works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Perla would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 59 years old and married with 4 children. 

Rafaela runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Rafaela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 46 years old and married with four children. She is from Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, she has managed a coconut and banana production business. She earns 3,000 PHP each month. Arlene joined GDMPC in 2010.

Arlene is requesting a 6,500 PHP loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 14 years, she has run a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines.

Lucia is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou is 23 years old and single with 2 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Lou runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Mary Lou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old and married with 7 children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buys stock of groceries to sell in her store.

Virginia has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Leonila requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Leonila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
La señora Erika nació en la ciudad del Cusco – Perú, tiene 36 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años. Ella es docente de educación inicial en una institución educativa de la ciudad, además adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de productos de uso domestico, como detergentes, y utensilios de aseo personal entre otros.

Erika necesita solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería, hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos. Ella en un futuro quiere poner su propia distribuidora de productos del hogar y darle mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.

La señora Erika pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Erika was born in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She is 36 years old, married, and has two children, ages four and seven.

She is an early childhood education teacher at a city educational institution.  She also sells household products like detergents and personal hygiene items, among others. 

Erika needs to request a loan in order to be able to buy more merchandiser, to make her business grow, and to increase her income.  In the future she wants to establish her own distributorship of household products.  She also wants to give a better quality of life to her whole family.

Erika belongs to the San Rafael communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy household products.

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Marison is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 12 years, she has run a shoe repair business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling clothes. 

Marison is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her shoe repair business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shoe repair business

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Charilyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Charilyn would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a shell-crafting business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years and she also earns an income from jeepney transport. Susan has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Susan is requesting a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her craft business. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 64 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en  el  Caserío Luchadores Sociales en el distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicios básicos de luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla Luis es la agricultura, teniendo 4.0 hectáreas de terreno agrícola en  la que tiene sembrado cultivo de limonero que cosecha semanalmente, y además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como ovinos. Luis cuenta con más de 20 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 1,500 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados en la  limpieza del campo y realizar la fertilización del cultivo de limón, además de realizar mejoras en el sistema de riego del cultivo (pagos de jornales). De esta manera, les da mantenimiento a su cultivo, haciendo que se desarrolle y sin problemas fitosanitarios  al momento de comercializarlo, y de está manera poder  atraer más a los consumidores.
texts.en:
Luis, age 64, is in a common-law marriage and has two children under his care.  He lives in his own house in the Luchadores Sociales settlement in the Tambogrrande district.  He lives in the rural part of this district, but he does have electricity.

Luis is a farmer.  He has four hectares of agricultural land where he has planted lemon crops that he harvests weekly.  He also raises small animals like sheep.  Luis has over 20 years of experience managing his business.

He has requested a loan for 1,500 soles, which will be used in clearing the fields and fertilizing his lemon crops.  He will also make improvements to the watering system for the crops (pay the day workers).  This way he gives maintenance to his crops, which makes them develop.   Then the crop will not have phytosanitary problems when it is time to sell it.  This way he will be able to attract more consumers.

loans.use: to pay day workers to provide maintenance to his crop.

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es:
Antenor  es un hombre de 40 años de edad, su estado civil es casado y tiene 2 hijos dependientes a su cargo. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos, su domicilio  está ubicado en el Caserío Palominos en el distrito de Tambogrande. Antenor vive en la parte rural  de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz eléctrica en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Antenor es la ganadería y agricultura. Sus animales al alcanzar el tamaño y peso ideal lo comercializa en el mercado local de la zona. Así mismo cuenta con clientes sólidos, que mayormente son comerciantes de carne. En la agricultura tiene 0.5 hectáreas de terreno, en las cuales tiene cultivos de arroz. Complementariamente trabaja como peón agrícola en los fundos del sector.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1,500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados para el mantenimiento y fertilización de su cultivo de arroz. Con las ganancias que deriven de la venta del arroz, se pagarán las obligaciones crediticias, puesto que la responsabilidad caracteriza a Antenor.
texts.en:
Antenor is a 40 year old married man, and he has two dependent children under his care.  He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the Palominos settlement in the Tambogrande district. Antenor lives in the rural part of this district, but he does have electrical service at his house.

Antenador raises livestock, and he farms.  When his animals reach the ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market in the area.  He has a well-established customer base, which is mostly comprised of meat dealers.  He has 0.5 hectare of farm land where he grows rice.  As a supplement, he also works as a day worker on the farms in his area.

He has requested 1,500 soles, which will be used for the maintenance and fertilization of his rice crop.  He will use the earnings from selling the rice to pay his loan obligations given that responsibility is characteristic of Antenor.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and fertilization of his rice crop.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria, a 52-year-old married mother of two children, has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for 20 years. She sells a variety of items including canned goods and detergent, and is now requesting a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more store stocks to sell.

In the future, Demetria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 35ans et est mariée à Samuel, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés de 6 à 12 ans.

Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis 1année.

Elle est à son  septième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité du riz à revendre, afin de gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait avoir son propre capital.
texts.en:
Pascasie, age 35, lives in Cibitoke and is a member of the group Twitezimbere. She is married to a farmer named Samuel, and they have three children aged 6 to 12. She started selling rice a year ago.

This is her seventh loan with Turame. She will use this credit obtained through KIVA to increase her working capital and purchase large quantities of rice to sell in order to bolster her revenue. 

In the coming years, she hopes to have her own capital.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of rice for resale.

loans.name: José Adán

texts.es: José Adán tiene 55  años de edad y vive en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar, el cual está conformado por su esposa y su hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad. Él  se dedica al comercio de tienda. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en su hogar de residencia el cual  ha sabido adecuar de acuerdo a las instalaciones de su casa de tal forma que pueda atraer la atención de los clientes. Él señor  es muy reconocido en la zona donde habita ya que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, responsable y sobre todo honesto, José es un ser humano sencillo. Muchas personas prefieren sus productos ya que ofrece variedad, calidad y buenos precios. Este negocio es muy importante para el  ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos,  esto lo impulsa a estar muy atento y muy pendiente del rumbo de su negocio, es decir, siempre está un paso adelante de la competencia de tal forma que su negocio pueda llegar a ser el líder en tiendas  en la zona donde habita. Todo esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tienda en la  compra de variedad de productos de tienda como: aceite, frijoles, arroz,  leche,  golosinas, azúcar, papel y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes,  de tal forma de que  estos siempre encuentren lo que buscan y estén satisfechos con su servicio. De esta manera espera vender más productos y   mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José Adán is 55 years old and lives in a house he owns, together with his family, which is made up of his wife and son, who is already of legal age. He makes a living from retail commerce. The business is located at the house where he lives; he has been able to adapt it to his house's layout in such a way that allows attracting customers' attention. The gentleman is very well known in the area where he lives, because he is very hard working, responsible and above all, honest. José is a simple human being. Lots of people prefer his products since he offers variety, quality and good prices. This business is very important to him since it is his main source of income, which drives him to be very aware of the direction his business takes. This means he is always a step ahead of the competition, so that his business can get to be the leader among all stores in the area where he lives. All of this has led him to make the decision of asking INTEGRAL for a loan, to invest in his store through the purchase of a variety of store products, such as: oil, beans, rice, milk, candy, sugar, paper and other items that will help attract more customers, in order to make sure they will always find what they are looking for and are satisfied with the service provided. In this way he hopes to sell more products and increase his income, so that he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase: oil, beans, rice, milk, candy, sugar, paper, etc.

loans.name: Tumenye Group

texts.fr:
Epimaque fait partie du groupe Tumenye et habite à Bujumbura.Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Esperance, commerçante  de la bière. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 3  à  7 ans, dont 2 étudient à l’école primaire.

Il est  tailleur depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son deuxième  crédit à  Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter les tissus et accessoires (fil, …) pour son métier.

Dans les prochains  jours, il voudrait  s’associer avec son ami pour faire le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sel,…)
texts.en:
Epimaque, age 33, lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the group Tumenye. He is married to Esperance, who sells beer. Together they have three children aged 3 to 7, two of whom attend primary school. 

Epimaque has been a tailor for ten years. This is his second loan with Turame. He plans to use this credit obtained through KIVA to increase his working capital and purchase fabrics and sewing notions.

In the near future, he would like to partner with his friend to open a food shop where they would sell rice, beans, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing notions.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  señora Maritza ahora tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hija de 17 años ,es una mujer muy trabajadora  y sola saca adelante a su única hija.

La socia trabaja en  el área de operaciones de una agencia de viajes y turismo, adicionalmente tiene un pequeño restaurante en el cual trabaja duro para que pueda crecer. La señora Maritza con este último ingreso ha logrado mejorar su economía y seguirá administrando de manera paralela sus actividades.

La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación del restaurante y en algunos detalles para mejorar su atención y servicio.

Maritza pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco, y agradece el apoyo que se le otorga y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 38 years old, single, and has one 17 year old daughter. She is a very hard-working woman and she alone helps her only daughter get ahead in life.

Maritza works in the operations area of a travel and tourism agency. In addition, she has a small restaurant in which she works hard in order for it to grow. With this last income she has been able to improve her economic situation and she will continue to manage her activities in parallel. Maritza requests this loan to invest in the operation of her restaurant and in some details to improve service. 

Maritza is a member of the San Rafael Communal Bank in the city of Cusco. She appreciates the support she is given and she commits to making her re-payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to support her restaurant.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 45 years old and married with three children.

Epefania works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to for her store.

Epefania has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Epefania aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan es un joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica es hacer taxi en un carro el cual el puede alquilar por horas.

Jhonatan busca mejorar sus ingresos económicos dedicándose al alquiler de equipos electrónicos para eventos sociales, y es justamente para ello que el solicita un préstamo, para adquirir un equipo de sonido, rentarlo y percibir un dinero que le ayude con su otra actividad que es el servicio de taxi.

Jhonatan pertenece al Banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL” de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is a young man of 20 years of age.  He lives in the city of Cusco and his economic activity is providing taxi service in a car that can be rented by the hour.

Jhonatan wants to improve his income by renting electronic equipment for social events.  It is for this that he is requesting a loan, to rent the equipment and to use the money he earns to help him with his other activity which is the taxi service.  

Jhonatan belongs to the communal bank "San Rafael" in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment to rent.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan es un joven estudiante de 23 años de edad y es de Cajamarca, él estudia para ser administrador de negocios internacionales en la universidad hace dos años se siente muy orgulloso por el apoyo total de su familia, el se esmera todos el días para poder obtener buenas calificaciones y estar entre los primeros de su clase, nos comenta que escogió este estudio  ya que desde adolescente le llamo mucha la atención como las personas se encargaban de sus propios negocios. nos cuenta que cuando termine sus estudios  quiere ser Gerente de produccion en una empresa industrial y ser muy exitoso y reconocido. Hernab es un joven estudiante con  grandes deseos de superación con metas bien establecidas y con gran futuro profesional.
texts.en: Hernan is a 23 year old student from Cajamarca.  He’s been studying International Business Administration at the university for two years and feels very proud about his entire family’s total support.  He strives daily to get the best grades and be among the leading students in his class.  He comments that he chose this area of study because since he was an adolescent he was interested in how people run their own businesses.  He tells us that when he completes his education he wants to be production manager for an industrial firm and to be very successful and well-known.  Hernan is a young student with a strong wish for self-improvement with well-established goals and a great professional future.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino  es un hombre de 55 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija de 18 años de edad a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Amaru Inca Valle de los Incas del distrito de Tambogrande. Paulino vive en esta  zona rural de este sector y no  cuenta con servicios básicos en su domicilio.
La actividad que desarrolla Paulino es la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agrícola de su propiedad  de 2.0  hectáreas en las cuales tiene sembrado plantaciones de limonero en producción que cosecha y vende semanalmente. Esta actividad la realiza hace más de 15 años, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral como pavos, gallinas, donde lo  comercializa en  el mercado local. Su esposa lo apoya en sus actividades complementarias, como en el cuidado de las aves y en las labores agrícolas.
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 1,500 nuevos soles y se destinará para el mantenimiento del cultivo de limón (en la compra de pesticidas, abonos foliares, bioestimulantes  y fertilizantes),y de esta manera darle al cultivo un buen control fitosanitario y obtener buenos rendimientos para una buena cosecha y comercialización de este.
texts.en:
Paulino, 55, is married and has an 18 year old daughter in his care.  He lives in his own house located in Amaru Inca Valle de los Incas hamlet in Tambogrande District.  Paulino lives in the rural part of this sector and his house does not have any basic utilities.

The activity Paulino does is farming.  He owns 2 hectares of farmland that he has planted with lemons that he harvests and sells weekly.  He’s been in this business for more than 15 years and he also works raising sheep and barnyard fowl like turkeys and chickens that he sells in the local market.  His wife helps him with his complementary activities like taking care of the fowl and with his farm chores.

The amount of the loan is 1500 new soles that he will use for lemon crop maintenance.  He will buy pesticides, leaf fertilizers, bio-stimulants and fertilizers to provide good care to his crops to obtain the best crop yields to sell.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, leaf fertilizers, bio-stimulants and fertilizer.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old. He lives in a small village in the Kareli District with his family: wife Nona, two sons (12 and 9 years old), and parents (retired). His children go to school. The family earns a living through agriculture. They have three hectares of land, where they grow cabbage and beets. George sells the harvested vegetables to local greengrocery retailers. In addition with the aforementioned business, George also has a mini-tractor which he uses to till the plot his family owns. He also provides tilling services to neighboring farmers. The family's total average monthly income is 1,000 Laris, including the pension George’s parents receive. 

George requested a loan to purchase fuel for the tractor in order to till the land. He will also purchase fertilizer and seeds of the aforementioned vegetables. George and Nona will work hard on their plot during the spring months. After proper seasonal work in spring, the family will get a better quality harvest than they did last year, and their income from sales will increase.
